thinking.disposable_income: Fort Bend Houston has relatively high median household income around $75,000, with many middle to upper-middle class professionals who have significant disposable income.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have moderate to high discretionary spending capacity and tend to prioritize quality of life investments, with many households able to absorb moderate increases in transportation costs.
thinking.accessibility: The area is car-dependent with good road access but limited transit options, though there is growing interest in improved public transportation connections to major employment centers.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies that balance driving convenience with gradual transit improvements given the car-dependent nature of the area. 2) Selected moderate tax rates (1.0%) that can fund transit while not overly burdening high discretionary spending. 3) Supported modest driving fees ($0.50) to reduce congestion while avoiding excessive costs. 4) Favored lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to encourage transit adoption. 5) Focused on options that achieve 22-23 minute car times and sub-60 minute transit times.
